message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: public byte[] toByteArray() {
    try {
        ByteArrayOutputStream realOutputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
        DataOutputStream dout = new DataOutputStream(realOutputStream);
        dout.writeUTF(dataObject.getClass().toString());
        dout.writeUTF(recordid);
        dout.flush();
        ByteArrayOutputStream objectStream = dataObject.toByteArrayOutputStream();
        dout.write(objectStream.toByteArray());
        dout.flush();
        dout.close();
        objectStream.close();
        return realOutputStream.toByteArray();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return null;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you are returning the byte array of the `objectStream` instead of the `realOutputStream`. The `realOutputStream` is the one that contains all the data you wrote using the `DataOutputStream`. So, you should return `realOutputStream.toByteArray()`. Also, you should call `dout.flush()` after writing the `objectStream` to the `DataOutputStream` to ensure that all data is written to the underlying `ByteArrayOutputStream`.
